meanings.definition: The act of throwing someone or something out of a window.
meanings.sent1: The defenestration of the ball from the window startled the passersby.
meanings.sent2: He witnessed the defenestration of the vase from the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The defenestration of the cat from the window was accidental but amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden defenestration of the papers created a whirlwind of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The defenestration of the toy airplane made quite an impression on the children below.

meanings.definition: The act of removing someone from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The defenestration of the manager shocked the employees.
meanings.sent2: The board's decision led to the defenestration of the CEO.
meanings.sent3: The defenestration of the class monitor was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: His defenestration from the presidency marked the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The defenestration of the dictator brought relief to the oppressed citizens.
